qas.question: In what conditions were forces first measured historically?
What do forces have with regard to additive quantities?
What is the resultant force called when two forces act on a particle?

answers.text: the resultant (also called the net force)

qas.question: When forces are acting on an extended body, what do you need to account for motion effects?

answers.text: their effects on the motion of the body

qas.question: What geometric shape is used in equations to determine net force?

plausible_answers.text: the resultant (also called the net force), can be determined

qas.question: When three forces act on a point particle, what happens?
What is also called the nut force?
The magnitude of the resultant varies from the similarities of what?
What must be specified in order to account for their effects on the motion of the head?

context: Historically, forces were first quantitatively investigated in <a0_2>conditions of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_3><a0_4>static equilibrium<a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> where several forces canceled each other out. Such experiments demonstrate the crucial properties that forces are additive vector quantities: they have <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>magnitude and direction<a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. When two forces act on a point particle, the resulting force, <a2_2><b5_0><b6_0>the resultant<b6_0/> (also called the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_3><a2_4>net force<a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_1/><a2_0/>)<a2_2/>, can be determined<b5_0/> by following the <a4_2><a4_4>parallelogram<a4_4/><a4_2/> rule of vector addition: the addition of two vectors represented by sides of a <a4_0><a4_1>parallelogram<a4_1/><a4_0/>, gives an equivalent resultant vector that is equal in magnitude and direction to the transversal of the <a4_3>parallelogram<a4_3/>. The magnitude of the resultant varies from the difference of the <b7_0>magnitudes<b7_0/> of the two forces to their sum, depending on the angle between their lines of action. However, if the forces are acting on an extended body, <a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>their <a3_0><a3_1>respective lines of application<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> must also be specified in order to account for <a3_4>their effects on the motion of the body<a3_4/>.
